title: APG 1.1 Checkbox Example (Two State)
description: This example implements the Checkbox Design Pattern for a two state checkbox using div elements.

ie.notes: Pressing the TAB or SHIFT+TAB keys to focus the first (or last) checkbox in the group caused the group label to be announced, but not the group role.

firefox.notes: Pressing the TAB or SHIFT+TAB keys to focus the first (or last) checkbox in the group caused the group label to be announced, but not the group role.

chrome.notes: Pressing the TAB or SHIFT+TAB keys to focus the first (or last) checkbox in the group caused the group label to be announced, but not the group role.

edge.notes: 1 of 4 and 4 of 4 implies the start and end of the list, but there was no indication of list exit.

edge.notes: List item role was implied by position in set information while in scan mode.

output.output: "list  with 4 items. check box  not checked. Lettuce"
"Sandwich Condiments grouping. list  with 4 items. Lettuce. check box  not checked."

firefox.notes: List item role implied when first entering the list due to list semantics being conveyed. However, once navigating items within the list, the list item role is not conveyed.

output.output: "list  with 4 items. check box  not checked. Lettuce"
"Sandwich Condiments grouping. list  with 4 items. Lettuce. check box  not checked."
"Not checked, lettuce, checkbox, in list, 4 items"
"Not checked, sprouts, checkbox, in list, 4 items"

and_chr.notes: List item semantics are only conveyed when entering the list, not when navigating within a list.

output.output: "list  with 4 items. check box  not checked. Lettuce"
"Sandwich Condiments grouping. list  with 4 items. Lettuce. check box  not checked."

firefox.notes: Position in set implied when first entering the list due to list semantics being conveyed for the first time. However, once navigating items within the list, the position in set information is no longer conveyed.

output.output: "list  with 4 items. check box  not checked. Lettuce"
"Sandwich Condiments grouping. list  with 4 items. Lettuce. check box  not checked."

chrome.notes: Position in set implied when first entering the list due to list semantics being conveyed for the first time. However, once navigating items within the list, the position in set information is no longer conveyed.

output.output: "Not checked, lettuce, checkbox, in list, 4 items"
"Not checked, sprouts, checkbox, in list, 4 items"

and_chr.notes: List item semantics are only conveyed when entering the list, not when navigating within a list.
